explain-architecture.prompt: Explain the architecture of this component in the context of GitMesh CE. Reference .vibe/core/architecture.md for system overview.

review-security.prompt: Review this code for security vulnerabilities. Check for: SQL injection, XSS, hardcoded secrets, improper input validation, weak authentication. Reference .vibe/core/security.md for security guidelines.

check-ce-ee.prompt: Check this code for CE/EE boundary violations. Look for: EE code references, proprietary dependencies, non-Apache 2.0 licenses. Reference .vibe/core/ce-ee-boundaries.md for rules.

generate-tests.prompt: Generate comprehensive tests for this code. Include: unit tests, integration tests (if applicable), property-based tests (if applicable). Follow patterns in .vibe/core/testing.md.

find-similar.prompt: Find similar code patterns in the codebase. Show me other implementations that follow the same pattern or solve similar problems.

explain-data-flow.prompt: Explain how data flows through this component and related components. Trace the data from input to output, including database operations, API calls, and transformations.

optimize-performance.prompt: Analyze this code for performance issues and suggest optimizations. Look for: N+1 queries, inefficient algorithms, missing indexes, unnecessary computations, memory leaks.

refactor-code.prompt: Suggest refactoring improvements for this code. Look for: code duplication, long functions, complex conditionals, poor naming, missing abstractions. Follow patterns in .vibe/core/coding-style.md.

cody.chat.preInstruction:
You are an AI assistant helping with GitMesh Community Edition development.

## Architecture
- Backend: Node.js/Express/TypeScript/Sequelize/PostgreSQL
- Frontend: Vue 3/Vite/TypeScript/Tailwind CSS
- Services: Python/Temporal/Redis/OpenSearch/SQS
- Infrastructure: Docker/Docker Compose/Nginx

Full details: .vibe/core/architecture.md

## Coding Standards
- TypeScript/JavaScript: ES6+, async/await, explicit types, no any
- Python: PEP 8, type hints, async/await
- Shell: POSIX compliance, error handling

Full details: .vibe/core/coding-style.md

## Critical Rules
- ✅ Apache 2.0 only (CE code)
- ❌ Never access EE code
- ✅ Validate all inputs
- ✅ Parameterized queries only
- ✅ Hash passwords (bcrypt, 12+ rounds)
- ❌ No secrets in code

Full details: .vibe/core/ce-ee-boundaries.md, .vibe/core/security.md

## Testing
- Write unit tests for all functions
- Write integration tests for APIs
- Write property-based tests for universal properties
- Coverage should be 70%+

Full details: .vibe/core/testing.md

## Memory Management
- Memory is scoped to current task only
- Use .vibe-memory/prd.json for task definition
- Use .vibe-memory/progress.txt for debugging
- NEVER create extra markdown files

Full details: .vibe/core/memory-management.md

## CRITICAL: Always Update PRD and Progress
BEFORE starting ANY task, you MUST:
1. Update .vibe-memory/prd.json - Add task with status "in_progress"
2. Log to .vibe-memory/progress.txt - Log start, attempts, solution

This is MANDATORY for all code changes.

Workflow:
1. Update PRD with task status
2. Log task start to progress file
3. Work on task and log attempts
4. Update PRD when complete
5. Clean failed attempts from progress file

## Search Patterns
When searching the codebase:
- Use semantic search for concepts and functionality
- Use exact search for specific identifiers
- Search across related files (model + service + controller)
- Look for similar patterns in existing code

## Code Navigation
When navigating code:
- Follow imports to understand dependencies
- Check usages to understand impact
- Review related files for context
- Look for tests to understand behavior

## Best Practices
- Search before implementing (avoid duplication)
- Follow existing patterns
- Write tests for new code
- Review security implications
- Keep CE and EE separate
- Document complex logic
